data.title: Interesting online radio stations with focus on electronic/experimental music
data.meta_description: I’m trying to find cool online radio stations in the vein of NTS, Dublab, etc, with focus in alternative, electronic, experimental music. I know some anglophone ones but would love to know more diverse and more focused o…
data.text:
I’m trying to find cool online radio stations in the vein of NTS, Dublab, etc, with focus in alternative, electronic, experimental music. I know some anglophone ones but would love to know more diverse and more focused on “local artists” ones.

These are some I know:

https://www.nts.live/ (based in London, United Kingdom)

https://www.dublab.com/ (based in Los Angeles, UEA)

https://modular-station.com/

https://longformeditions.com/ (not a radio stations but cool mixtapes anyway)

https://www.thelotradio.com/ (based in Greenpoint, NYC, UEA)

https://stegi.radio/ (based in Athens, Greece)

https://lyl.live/ (native to Lyon, France)

https://radiorelativa.eu/ (based in Madrid, Spain)

https://www.intergalactic.fm/ (based in The Hague?, Netherlands)

Added (who suggested it):

https://www.sub.fm/ (@blaize)

https://www.retreatradio.net/ (@proskynesis)

https://9128.live/ (@graeissepia)

https://somafm.com/ (@alechko)

Rinse Kool FM | Rinse FM (@proskynesis)

https://www.noodsradio.com/ (@looms)

https://echobox.radio/ (@Zijnvolt)

OpenLab (@Native_Layer)

https://resonancefm.com/ (@KF6GPE)

https://radio.garden/ (@Forklift)

https://www.netilradio.com/ (@waftlord)

Stream 10k Radio music | Listen to songs, albums, playlists for free on SoundCloud (schoolbabyboy)

Chill Channel (AhNaLogo)

https://hirschmilch.de/ (deadfly)

https://beloved.wtf/ (thesimplemachine)

https://radiooooo.com/ (d4ydream)

https://repeater-radio.com/ (DoS)

What would you add?

I like subfm

Malmö, Sweden

9128.live fantastic radio station!

check the station descriptions to see the rough genre focus, one of my favorite radios ever.

my personal favs are groove salad, deep space one, drone zone, cliqhop idm, the dark zone, beat blender…

(from SoMa SF)

Looks like Kool Fm is under Rinse now but yeah, Rinse and Kool

https://www.noodsradio.com/ Bristol, UK

There’s an iOS app for Rinse/Kool now too, lots of good archive stuff on there.

https://echobox.radio/ is an amazing Amsterdam based station.

Resonance and Resonance Extra (resonancefm.com) have a lot of good stuff. I particularly like Resonance Extra for the experimental field recording stuff they run frequently.

I’d echo @alechko about SomaFM, too. Great set of stations, and pretty cool merch. I have a ridiculous number of stickers from them.

I use an app very similar to Google Earth to search for interesting broadcast radios:

Well, it’s not electronic oriented, there’s any type of sound. I find it fun to listen to for those non-globalized nations where I can finally find something that amazes me

Incredible stuff, added all your submissions!

electronic music not always the focus, but that’s never a bad tihng.

I make a radio show podcast on Soundcloud where I showcase music from artists with less than 10,000 followers on Soundcloud. Focuses mostly on bass focused music but theres also chiller, brighter music highlighted as well!

I really dig Psyndora Chillout!

That Synphaera channel on SomaFM is top notch as well!

+1 for Soma and NTS

Also I just discovered Hirschmilch which seems to have about 3 decent stations

Groove Salad is awesome! Used to listen to this over a Shoutcast stream on Winamp back in the early 2000s.

Great thread! Jumped on to suggest intergalactic fm but it’s already in the OP. Some awesome recommendations here and many I’ve not heard of so keen to get exploring - thanks!

Beloved Radio, based in Chicago, has drawn comparisons to NTS and Dublab in local publications. They’ve only been around a year, but doing some cool stuff focusing on musician- and artist-curated shows rather than strictly DJs.
